ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'

about.summary: We provide the collection of data-sets used in the book 'An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R'.
We provide the collection of data-sets used in the book 'An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R'.

name: r-islr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.4' %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-islr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ISLR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ISLR/ISLR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 7151c636808198ee759cbcf22f82a7aa76580fb8d11e4cd67f69f85401c820c3

build:
  noarch: generic
  # If this is a new build for the same version, increment the build number.
  number: 4
  # no skip

  # This is required to make R link correctly on Linux.
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

# Suggests: MASS
requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]

  host:
    - r-base

  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    # You can put additional test commands to be run here.
    - $R -e "library('ISLR')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ISLR')\""  # [win]

  # You can also put a file called run_test.py, run_test.sh, or run_test.bat
  # in the recipe that will be run at test time.

  # requires:
    # Put any additional test requirements here.

about:
  home: https://www.statlearning.com
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: We provide the collection of data-sets used in the book 'An Introduction to Statistical
    Learning with Applications in R'.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - l2dy

# The original CRAN metadata for this package was:

# Package: ISLR
# Type: Package
# Title: Data for an Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R
# Version: 1.4
# Date: 2021-09-14
# Author: Gareth James, Daniela Witten, Trevor Hastie and Rob Tibshirani
# Maintainer: Trevor Hastie <hastie@stanford.edu>
# Suggests: MASS
# Description: We provide the collection of data-sets used in the book 'An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R'.
# Depends: R (>= 3.5.0)
# License: GPL-2
# LazyLoad: yes
# LazyData: yes
# URL: https://www.statlearning.com
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2021-09-15 01:19:20 UTC; hastie
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2021-09-15 05:30:09 UTC

# See
# https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build for
# more information about meta.yaml
